meanings.sent1: She tried to lateralize the book on the shelf.
meanings.sent2: The dancers lateralize their movements to the music.
meanings.sent3: The cat decided to lateralize its nap to the sunny spot by the window.
meanings.sent4: The students were asked to lateralize their desks for group work.
meanings.sent5: The chef's secret to perfect pancakes is to lateralize the batter evenly in the pan.

meanings.definition: To move or position to one side.
meanings.sent1: He had to lateralize the chair to make space for the new table.
meanings.sent2: The cars lateralize to allow the ambulance to pass through.
meanings.sent3: The siblings playfully lateralize their toys to annoy each other.
meanings.sent4: The tree branches lateralize in the wind, creating a beautiful dance.
meanings.sent5: The teacher asked the students to lateralize their backpacks to clear the aisle.
